name: Kepler-234
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-234 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-234 is a star with 1.1239999999999997 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.11 times its radius. It is located 5939.33 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-234 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-234 b

Kepler-234 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.71 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-234.

The mass of Kepler-234 b is 22.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-234 b is 3.7 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-234 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-234 c

Kepler-234 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.21 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-234.

The mass of Kepler-234 c is 19.56 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-234 c is 3.51 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-234 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-234, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
